Class Card

java.lang.Object
model.cards.Card
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
Direct Known Subclasses:
JokerCard, SuitCard
public abstract class Card extends Object implements Serializable
Represents an abstract card in the Jest card game. This class serves as the base for all card types (SuitCard, JokerCard) and provides common functionality including visibility management, card effects, and visitor pattern support.

Key features:

  • Serializable for game state persistence
  • Supports various card effects for trophy determination
  • Can be visible or hidden from players
  • Implements the Visitor pattern for score calculation

Card effects can be configured with optional parameters:

  • No parameter: JOKER, BEST_JEST, BEST_JEST_WITHOUT_JOKER, etc.
  • Sign parameter: HIGHEST, LOWEST (specifies target suit)
  • Value parameter: MAJORITY (specifies target value)
See Also:
  • SuitCard
  • JokerCard
  • CardEffect
  • CardVisitor
  • Serialized Form

  • Constructor Details

    • Card

      public Card(boolean isVisible, CardEffect cardEffect)
      Constructs a Card with a basic card effect (no parameters).

      Valid effects for this constructor:

      • JOKER
      • BEST_JEST
      • BEST_JEST_WITHOUT_JOKER
      • MOST_CARDS (expansion)
      • LEAST_CARDS (expansion)
      • EVEN_VALUES (expansion)
      • ODD_VALUES (expansion)
      • NO_DUPLICATES (expansion)
      Parameters:
      isVisible - true if the card should be visible to all players, false if hidden
      cardEffect - the card effect (must not require parameters)
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the card effect requires a parameter (HIGHEST, LOWEST, or MAJORITY)

    • Card

      public Card(boolean isVisible, CardEffect cardEffect, Sign signEffect)
      Constructs a Card with a sign-based card effect.

      This constructor is used for effects that target specific suits:

      • HIGHEST - Awards trophy to player with highest value of the specified suit
      • LOWEST - Awards trophy to player with lowest value of the specified suit
      Parameters:
      isVisible - true if the card should be visible to all players, false if hidden
      cardEffect - the card effect (must be HIGHEST or LOWEST)
      signEffect - the target suit sign for the effect
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the card effect is MAJORITY (which requires an int value)

    • Card

      public Card(boolean isVisible, CardEffect cardEffect, int valueEffect)
      Constructs a Card with a value-based card effect.

      This constructor is used for the MAJORITY effect:

      • MAJORITY - Awards trophy to player with most cards of the specified value (1-7)
      Parameters:
      isVisible - true if the card should be visible to all players, false if hidden
      cardEffect - the card effect (typically MAJORITY)
      valueEffect - the target card value for the effect (between 1 and 7)
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the card effect is HIGHEST or LOWEST (which require a Sign parameter)

  • Method Details

    • isVisible

      public boolean isVisible()
      Checks whether this card is visible to all players.
      Returns:
      true if the card is visible, false if hidden

    • setVisible

      public void setVisible(boolean isVisible)
      Sets the visibility of this card. Hidden cards are not shown to other players but can still be picked.
      Parameters:
      isVisible - true to make the card visible, false to hide it

    • getCardEffectCode

      public String getCardEffectCode()
      Returns a formatted string representation of the card effect with its parameters. The format varies based on the effect type:
      • Sign-based effects: "EFFECT_NAME SIGN" (e.g., "HIGHEST SPADE")
      • Value-based effects: "EFFECT_NAME VALUE" (e.g., "MAJORITY 3")
      • No-parameter effects: "EFFECT_NAME" (e.g., "BEST_JEST")
      Returns:
      a string describing the card effect and its parameters

    • checkEffect

      public Player checkEffect(ArrayList<Player> players)
      Evaluates this card's effect to determine which player wins it as a trophy. This method is called at the end of the game to award trophy cards based on the card's specific effect and the players' jest piles.
      Parameters:
      players - the list of all players to evaluate for the trophy
      Returns:
      the Player who wins this trophy card, or null if no player qualifies
      See Also:
      • CardEffect.CheckEffect(int, Sign, ArrayList)

    • accept

      public abstract void accept(CardVisitor visitor)
      Accepts a CardVisitor to perform operations on this card. This method is part of the Visitor pattern implementation and must be implemented by concrete card classes (SuitCard, JokerCard).

      Typical usage:

      CardVisitor visitor = new JestScoreVisitor();
card.accept(visitor);
      Parameters:
      visitor - the CardVisitor that will visit this card
      See Also:
      • CardVisitor
